Facebook | Twitter | LinkedIn |  LibraryThing 
What Am I About? 
My professional goal has been to help organizations connect with their communities through the 
appropriate & effective use of technology. 
To do this, I bring strong research, analytical, creative and humanist approaches to: 

strategic business and project planning, 

critical assessment of trends, technologies, risks & opportunities for services deployment, 

information architectures and business processes, 

expert communications skills. 
I have provided these services to: 

25+ government departments and agencies, 

international organizations including IFLA, NISO, and UNESCO, 

cultural sector organizations (libraries, museums, archives), 

industry groups and small- and medium-sized enterprises, 

non-profit sector. 
After 25 years in the private sector, I joined the public service in 2015. I am currently developing and 
managing Drupal-based web services, social media, and online consultations with the Canadian 
Transportation Agency. 
I am an experienced public speaker and communicator. I have spoken nationally and internationally to 
many professional groups on a variety of subjects. 
Through my information architecture practice, I have conducted dozens of focus groups and stakeholder 
engagement sessions, stakeholder survey design, observational task analysis, and UX testing. I am a 
regular participant in various GC communities. I provide care and feeding of DIGLIB, an international 
community for digital library research and development. 
My professional research interests are: 

UX and design research; 

commitment to open access to information and open software; 

social media developments, standards & tools; 

interoperability & metadata standards (classification, thesauri, vocabulary); 

social and web metrics & performance indicators; and 

information policy.
